<gallery>
Fichier:Syphilis chancre LISA.jpg|alt=The description: single, clean-bottomed, painless and indurated is not always de rigueur. Here the background is fibrinous. Any ulceration of the genitals is syphilis until proven otherwise.|Syphilitic chancre: painless ulceration opposite the frenulum of the penis.
</gallery>

properties.question: What is a distinguishing feature of a primary syphilis chancre?
properties.option_a: It is typically painful and located on the shaft of the penis.
properties.option_b: It is usually multiple and covered with a thick, white exudate.
properties.option_c: It is often painless, clean-bottomed, and indurated.
properties.option_d: It is commonly accompanied by flu-like symptoms and swollen lymph nodes.
